If you're looking for something entirely different, I'd recommend "I Heart Huckabees" (2004). With Dustin Hoffman and Lily Tomlin as the leads, it's a delightful and offbeat ride that will keep you guessing.

constraints.name: Born on the Fourth of July

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I think you might enjoy "Schindler's List"! It's a powerful and emotional film that explores the true story of Oskar Schindler, who risked everything to save thousands of Jews during World War II. With outstanding performances from Liam Neeson and Ralph Fiennes, this Academy Award-winning film is not only a gripping war drama but also a thought-provoking exploration of humanity in the face of tragedy.

If you're looking for something a bit more unique, I'd recommend "The White Countess"! This romantic drama is set against the backdrop of 1930s Shanghai and features an all-star cast, including Ralph Fiennes. With its intriguing plot and stunning visuals, this film is sure to captivate your attention.

(Please note that I didn't suggest "Chain Reaction" as it's not a war movie, and "The Violent Kind" seems more like a horror or thriller, which might not fit the genre you're looking for.)

constraints.name: Born on the Fourth of July
